intro: Astragalus vesicarius var. pastellianus, commonly known as the pastellian milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. This variety is often found in steppe and desert scrub habitats.
